metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3353 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Cowbell 0.2.7.1 places a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in the current working directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cowbell - 0.2.7.1-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cowbell package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.7.1-7').
